titleStmt.title: To THOMAS MITTON,Thomas Mitton (1812-78), solicitor, one of CD’s earliest close friends. He acted as CD’s solicitor for twenty years: see further Pilgrim Letters 1, p. 35n. 24 FEBRUARY 1843

dateline.date: Twenty Fourth February 1843The date is at the end of the letter.

body.p: I write, in the greatest haste, to say that I will see you early next week. My little captain of the Britannia,John Hewitt (c.1812-1850), master of the Britannia, in which CD sailed to the United States, Jan 42. CD described Hewitt in American Notes, Ch. 1, as “a wellmade, tight-built, dapper little fellow”. See further Pilgrim Letters 3, p. 7n. unexpectedly shewed on Wednesday morning, and I am tearing my legs off, in shewing him the Lions.I.e. the sights. For some account of Hewitt’s visit, see To Felton, 2 Mar 43, Pilgrim Letters 3, p. 452.
